question: Why were Finn and his gigantic relatives at the Giant's Causeway?
answer1: to make a bridge

question: Where did Finn work?
answer1: the Giant's Causeway

question: What happened after Finn lopped off the roots and branches of a fir-tree?
answer1: He made a walking-stick of it and set out on his way to Oonagh.

question: Where did Finn live?
answer1: on Knockmany Hill

question: Who was Finn's wife?
answer1: Oonagh

question: Why was Far Rua well-known?
answer1: No other giant could stand before him.
answer2: When well vexed, he could give a stamp that shook the country about him.

question: What did Finn do to avoid Far Rua?
answer1: kept dodging about from place to place

question: Why was Far Rua coming to Causeway?
answer1: to have a trial of strength with Finn

question: How did Finn's wife feel being alone?
answer1: lonely

question: Why did Finn give a short good-humored cough and laugh heartily?
answer1: to show Oonagh how much he was delighted that she made herself happy in his absence

question: What did Far Rua always carry with him?
answer1: a thunderbolt

question: What did Finn always do to prophesize or know anything?
answer1: clapped his thumb in his mouth

question: Where did Finn prophesize Far Rua was at?
answer1: Dungannon

question: Who had been troubling Finn?
answer1: Far Rua

question: Why did Finn's heart quiet?
answer1: He knew that Oonagh was hand-and-glove with the fairies.

question: Who was Oonagh's sister?
answer1: Granua

question: Where did Granua live?
answer1: on the very top of Cullamore

question: What did Oonagh and Granua do on summer evenings?
answer1: held many agreeable conversation across the valley

question: What was Granua doing when Oonagh spoke to her?
answer1: picking bilberries at Althadhawn
answer2: picking bilberries at the Devil's Glen

question: What did Granua see when she looked about?
answer1: the biggest giant that ever was known coming up from Dungannon

question: Why did Granua say she would tell Far Rua to refresh himself at Cullamore?
answer1: to give Oonagh and Finn time to think of some plan to get themselves out of the scrape

question: What did Granua want from Oonagh?
answer1: fifteen or sixteen tubs, or the largest miscaun

question: What happened after Oonagh threw the miscaun?
answer1: The miscaun fell about half-way between the two hills at the edge of the Broad Bog, near Augher.

question: What did Oonagh forget to do before throwing the miscaun?
answer1: say the charm that was to send it up

question: What did the miscaun turn into?
answer1: a grey stone

question: What will Granua do if all else fails?
answer1: She will give FInn a cast of heather broth, or a panada of oak bark.

question: How did Finn feel in the meantime?
answer1: melancholy

question: How did Oonagh find out the best way of succeeding in anything?
answer1: drew the nine woollen threads of different colors

question: What did Oonagh do with the iron griddles?
answer1: kneaded into the hearts of one-and-twenty cakes of bread

question: What happened after Oonagh prepared the threads?
answer1: Oonagh sent round to the neighbors and borrowed one-and-twenty iron griddles.

question: What will happen if Finn lost the middle finger on his right hand?
answer1: He will be no more than a common man.

question: What did Oonagh desire Finn to do?
answer1: lie down in the cradle and cover himself up with the clothes

question: Who was named the strongest and bravest man in Ireland?
answer1: Finn M'Coul

question: Why was Finn not at home?
answer1: He set out there to try if he could catch Far Rua.

question: What did Far Rua do after he pulled the middle finger and cracked it three times?
answer1: went outside, and getting his arms about the house, completely turned it as Oonagh had wished

question: What did Far Rua do after he cracked his right middle finger?
answer1: stooped down, tore a cleft about four hundred feet deep and a quarter of a mile in length

question: What did Oonagh depend on?
answer1: her woman's wit

question: Why didn't Finn pull the well asunder?
answer1: He left the place in such a fury that he never thought of it.

question: Why did Oonagh treat Far Rua kindly in her house?
answer1: If she didn't do it, Finn would not be pleased with her.

question: How did Oonagh and Finn feel when they heard a noise that resembled something between a growl and a yell?
answer1: stunned

question: What happened after Far Rua bit into one of the cakes?
answer1: Two of Far Rua's teeth were out.

question: Who could eat Finn's bread?
answer1: Finn

question: What did Finn do that frightened the giant?
answer1: gave a skirl

question: What did Oonagh give Finn when he was in the cradle?
answer1: a cake that had no griddle in it

question: Why did Far Rua thank his stars that he missed meeting Finn?
answer1: He'd have no chance with a man who could eat such bread as that, which even his son that's in the cradle can munch before his eyes.

question: What happened after Far Rua squeezed the stone?
answer1: He got black in the face with the efforts.

question: How did Finn trick the giant into thinking he squeezed water out of the stone?
answer1: Finn took the stone, slyly exchanged it for the curds, and squeezed until the whey oozed out.

question: What did Far Rua assure Oonagh?
answer1: He never wished to hear of, much less to see, her husband.

question: How did Finn feel about Far Rua about to departure?
answer1: delight

question: Why was Finn delighted?
answer1: Far Rua was about to take his departure without discovering the tricks that been played off on him.

question: What did Far Rua ask before he left?
answer1: what kind of teeth could eat griddle-cakes like that

question: How did Far Rua feel finding the powerful grinders in the child?
answer1: surprised

question: What happened after Far Rua laid a finger where Finn's strength depended?
answer1: Far Rua gave one loud groan and fell down at once with terror and weakness.

question: Why did Finn want Far Rua to lay a finger where his strength depended?
answer1: He now knew that his most powerful and bitterest enemy was completely at his mercy.

question: Why did Far Rua swear he would never rest?
answer1: He wanted to give Finn a considerable beating.
answer2: He wanted to defeat every giant.
answer3: He had not beaten Finn yet.

question: Why did Finn have a strong disinclination to meet Far Rua?
answer1: He did not want to be beaten by Far Rua.
answer3: Far Rua had a bad temper.

question: How will Oonagh feel when Finn comes home?
answer1: happy

question: Why did Finn say he would sooner or later meet Far Rua?
answer1: His thumb told him so.
answer3: Far Rua was always looking for him.

question: How will Granua feel when she sees Far Rua?
answer1: terrified

question: How will Granua feel when she does not receive the miscaun?
answer1: disappointed

question: How did Far Rua know he was invited to the top of Cullamore?
answer1: He heard three whistles.
answer2: He saw smoke on top of the hill.
answer3: He remembered a sign that meant strangers were welcomed.

question: Why was Finn very melancholy?
answer1: Far Rua was going to defeat him.
answer2: Finn did not know what to do.

question: Why did Finn have great confidence in his wife?
answer1: She had got him out of many troubles.

question: Why did Finn lie in the cradle?
answer1: His wife told him to.
answer2: He had to hide from Far Rua.
answer3: He had to pretend to be his own child.

question: How will Finn feel pretending to be a child in a cradle?
answer1: ridiculous

question: Why did Far Rua never see Finn?
answer1: Finn was always hiding.
answer3: Far Rua never got close to Finn to know what he looked like.

question: Why did Oonagh bring Far Rua to the well?
answer1: to distract Far Rua
answer2: to give Finn time to escape
answer3: to ask Far Rua for a favor

question: What will happen when Far Rua bites into another cake?
answer1: Far Rua's teeth will fall out.
answer2: Far Rua will become more hungry.
answer3: Far Rua will become more angry.

question: Why did Far Rua want to see the child in the cradle?
answer1: to know what Finn's child looked like
answer2: to see the child eat the cake
answer3: to see if he was being tricked

question: How will Far Rua feel when the baby squeezes water out of the stone?
answer1: shocked

question: Why will Far Rua avoid Finn in the future?
answer1: Finn will be much stronger than Far Rua.
answer3: Finn's child will be very strong.
